title: Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers | Science & Engineering Kit | Build 20 Models | Learn about Force, Load, Compression, Tension | Parents' Choice Gold Award Winner, Blue
descriptions:
Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers

A friendly, hands-on kit that lets you (or a grandchild you’re helping) build sturdy mini bridges and tall towers at home. No prior experience needed. Clear, picture-based instructions guide you step by step.

What it is:
- A science and engineering kit with 285 blue pieces.
- Build up to 20 different models, including several types of bridges and simple skyscraper designs.
- Winner of the Parents’ Choice Gold Award, recognized for quality and learning.

Why you’ll like it:
- Easy-to-follow book: A 36-page, illustrated manual shows each step with pictures. Large, clear drawings reduce guesswork.
- Go at your own pace: Build one model at a time. Stop and start whenever you like.
- Learn by doing: See how real structures stay strong. Simple ideas are explained in plain language.

What you’ll learn (in everyday terms):
- Forces that push and pull, like tension (pulling) and compression (pushing).
- How parts like columns and beams hold up weight.
- Why shapes like arches and triangles make things strong.
- How builders design for safety and use materials wisely.

What you can build:
- Bridge styles: truss, arch, cantilever, rope, and suspension.
- Structural elements: columns, beams, trusses, plates, arches, shells, and catenary curves.

Good to know:
- Skill level: Intermediate, but very approachable thanks to the picture guide.
- Designed for curious adults and kids working together.
- Encourages careful thinking, steady hands, and satisfying results.

If you enjoy puzzles, model kits, or sharing a constructive activity with family, this set offers hours of relaxing, rewarding fun—with real-world learning built in.
